definition: to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: These items will be in a tight liquidity environment to compete.
sentences.chinese: 這些項目將在流動資金緊絀的環境的競爭力。

sentences.english: How vulnerable is your cash flow to changes in any parameter of your calculations?
sentences.chinese: 如果計算參數變化，你的流動資金會有多麼不堪一擊？

sentences.english: EBITDA should not be considered as a measure of our liquidity.
sentences.chinese: 折舊及攤銷不應被視爲衡量我們的流動資金。

sentences.english: Working capital not in cash form, i. e. receivables and inventories.
sentences.chinese: 非現金形式的流動資金，如應收款和庫存。

sentences.english: However, the excess inventory of spare parts will affect the use of current fund.
sentences.chinese: 然而，過剩的備件庫存，又將影響流動資金佔用。

sentences.english: Yes, indeed, China does have cash flow.
sentences.chinese: 是的，的確，中國確實有着流動資金。

sentences.english: Most financial professionals came to worship liquidity as the silver bullet for reviving economies.
sentences.chinese: 多數金融專家來崇拜流動資金作爲銀彈重振經濟。

sentences.english: The circulating fund of state-owned enterprises is regulated by the central bank.
sentences.chinese: 國營企業流動資金由人民銀行統一管理。

definition: to repay a debt in full/to redeem/to clear
to lend money (for interest)/to give credit
remittance/funds paid to a bank account
